hints.label: def-qsd-mean-field
hints.title: Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD)
hints.content:
59: :label: def-qsd-mean-field
60: 
61: A probability measure $\rho_\infty \in \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ is a **quasi-stationary distribution** for the mean-field generator $\mathcal{L}$ if:
62: 
63: 1. **Stationarity**: $\mathcal{L}[\rho_\infty] = 0$
64: 2. **Normalization**: $\|\rho_\infty\|_{L^1} = M_\infty < 1$ (mass less than 1 due to killing)
hints.raw_directive:
56: ### 0.2. Definition of QSD
57: 
58: :::{prf:definition} Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD)
59: :label: def-qsd-mean-field
60: 
61: A probability measure $\rho_\infty \in \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ is a **quasi-stationary distribution** for the mean-field generator $\mathcal{L}$ if:
62: 
63: 1. **Stationarity**: $\mathcal{L}[\rho_\infty] = 0$
64: 2. **Normalization**: $\|\rho_\infty\|_{L^1} = M_\infty < 1$ (mass less than 1 due to killing)
65: 3. **Support**: $\text{supp}(\rho_\infty) \subseteq \Omega$ (concentrated on alive region)
